result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy R Snell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $100 + costs = $579.00,  to be paid in $100 per month installments commencing on 8/28/15 and on the 28th day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 11 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

With JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 10:43am [mo]
Defendant Jeremy R Snell in court with Attorney Deborah A. Strigenz.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Jeffrey Shock verifies victim rights compliance

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $100 + costs = $579.00,  to be paid in $100 per month installments commencing on 8/28/15 and on the 28th day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 11 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

0 days credit

Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case
Bond conditions include: no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

[MK] case called at 2:08pm. 
Defendant Jeremy R Snell in court.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Snell provides a new address:  841 Eastern Avenue, Apt. #1, West Bend WI. 
Service of Complaint admitted, the charge and maximum penalties are recited; the reading of the factual portion of the Criminal Complaint is waived.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.  The Court refers Mr. Snell to contact the PD Office to apply for representation. 
After Mr. Snell indicates that he is trying to retain counsel, the Court adjourns the Initial Appearance. 

The Court requires $250 signature bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
recess 2:16pm. 


NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance on 6/2/15 at 2:00pm.
